articles.headline: Fed Prepares Another Rate Increase as Wall Street Wonders What’s Next
articles.snippet: Central bankers around the world have been picking up the pace of rate increases. Now the big question looms: When will they slow down?
articles.abstract: Central bankers around the world have been picking up the pace of rate increases. Now the big question looms: When will they slow down?
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials are set to make a second abnormally large interest rate increase this week as they race to cool down an overheating economy. The question for many economists and investors is just how far the central bank will go in its quest to tame inflation.

articles.headline: Top Pence Aides Testify to Grand Jury in Jan. 6 Investigation
articles.snippet: Marc Short, who was chief of staff to Vice President Mike Pence, and Greg Jacob, a lawyer for Mr. Pence, were subpoenaed in the Justice Department’s expanding criminal inquiry.
articles.abstract: Marc Short, who was chief of staff to Vice President Mike Pence, and Greg Jacob, a lawyer for Mr. Pence, were subpoenaed in the Justice Department’s expanding criminal inquiry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two top aides to former Vice President Mike Pence testified last week to a federal grand jury in Washington investigating the events surrounding the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, the highest-ranking officials of the Trump administration so far known to have cooperated with the Justice Department’s widening inquiry into the events leading up to the assault.
articles.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: U.S. Officials Grow More Concerned About Potential Action by China on Taiwan
articles.snippet: The Biden administration is watching for any moves by China to close off the Taiwan Strait, and they would prefer that Nancy Pelosi cancel her planned trip.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration is watching for any moves by China to close off the Taiwan Strait, and they would prefer that Nancy Pelosi cancel her planned trip.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration has grown increasingly anxious this summer about China’s statements and actions regarding Taiwan, with some officials fearing that Chinese leaders might try to move against the self-governing island over the next year and a half — perhaps by trying to cut off access to all or part of the Taiwan Strait, through which U.S. naval ships regularly pass.
articles.byline: By Edward Wong, David E. Sanger and Amy Qin

articles.headline: Pope Apologizes in Canada for Schools That Abused Indigenous Children
articles.snippet: Francis, responding to longtime pleas from Indigenous people, begged forgiveness for schools where children were forced to assimilate, many were sexually or physically abused and some died.
articles.abstract: Francis, responding to longtime pleas from Indigenous people, begged forgiveness for schools where children were forced to assimilate, many were sexually or physically abused and some died.
articles.lead_paragraph: MASKWACIS, Alberta — Pope Francis offered a sweeping apology directly to Indigenous people on their land in Canada on Monday, fulfilling a critical demand of many of the survivors of church-run residential schools that became gruesome centers of abuse, forced assimilation, cultural devastation and death for over a century.
articles.byline: By Jason Horowitz and Ian Austen

articles.headline: Is Recession Staring Us Down? Already Upon Us? Here’s Why It’s Hard to Say.
articles.snippet: The U.S. may register a second straight quarter of economic contraction, one benchmark of a recession. But that won’t be the last word.
articles.abstract: The U.S. may register a second straight quarter of economic contraction, one benchmark of a recession. But that won’t be the last word.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States is not in a recession.

articles.headline: Biden’s Drug Czar Is Leading the Charge for a ‘Harm Reduction’ Approach
articles.snippet: Experts describe the president’s drug control strategy as the most progressive since Richard Nixon appointed the nation’s first drug czar in 1971.
articles.abstract: Experts describe the president’s drug control strategy as the most progressive since Richard Nixon appointed the nation’s first drug czar in 1971.
articles.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. — During a recent interview here, Dr. Rahul Gupta, President Biden’s drug czar, appeared to be on the verge of supporting a radical shift in U.S. drug control policy.

articles.headline: After Enduring a Pandemic, Small Businesses Face New Worries
articles.snippet: It has been a tough few years for companies without the scale to cruise through disruption. Making money isn’t getting any easier.
articles.abstract: It has been a tough few years for companies without the scale to cruise through disruption. Making money isn’t getting any easier.
articles.lead_paragraph: America’s small businesses can’t catch a break.

articles.headline: The I.M.F. warns that a global recession could soon be at hand.
articles.snippet: The International Monetary Fund downgraded its growth forecasts and projected higher inflation around the world.
articles.abstract: The International Monetary Fund downgraded its growth forecasts and projected higher inflation around the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: The world could soon be on the brink of a global recession as the economies of the United States, China and Europe slow more sharply than anticipated amid a collision of crises, the International Monetary Fund warned on Tuesday.

articles.headline: ‘Operating With Increased Intensity’: Zuckerberg Leads Meta Into Next Phase
articles.snippet: Facebook’s founder is setting a relentless pace as he pushes his company through a tech transformation during a global economic slowdown.
articles.abstract: Facebook’s founder is setting a relentless pace as he pushes his company through a tech transformation during a global economic slowdown.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Mark Zuckerberg, the founder and chief executive of the company formerly known as Facebook, called his top lieutenants for the social network to a last-minute meeting in the San Francisco Bay Area this month. On the agenda: a “work-athon” to discuss the road map for improving the main Facebook app, including a revamp that would change how users browse the service.

articles.headline: Trump-Pence Ticket, Torn by Jan. 6, Becomes an Unequal Rivalry
articles.snippet: Trailed by the Capitol riot fallout and 2024 speculation, the two erstwhile allies gave competing speeches that revealed the Republican Party’s enduring challenges and divisions.
articles.abstract: Trailed by the Capitol riot fallout and 2024 speculation, the two erstwhile allies gave competing speeches that revealed the Republican Party’s enduring challenges and divisions.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Eighteen months after departing the nation’s capital for the final time as president, Donald J. Trump returned on Tuesday confronting federal investigations, fresh doubts about his viability in an increasingly likely third White House bid and an emerging rivalry with his erstwhile running mate.
